column1: This may be due to: - Hemolytic anemia - Chronic lymphocytic leukemia or similar disorder - Erythroblastosis fetalis (hemolytic disease of the newborn) - Infectious mononucleosis - Mycoplasmal infection - Syphilis - Systemic lupus erythematosus - Transfusion reaction, such as one due to improperly matched units of blood The test may also be abnormal without any clear cause, especially among the elderly.
